episodeTitle: Leaving the Dadan Family!? The Secret Base is Complete!
description: After Garp discovers the three brothers' pirate ambitions and threatens them, Luffy, Ace, and Sabo flee and decide to build their own hideout. They gather materials from the Gray Terminal and construct a treehouse resembling a pirate ship, complete with booby traps. Meanwhile, Dadan worries about the boys and eventually finds them, triggering their trap.

events.title: Garp Attacks the Brothers for Their Pirate Dreams
events.description: Vice Admiral Garp discovers that Luffy, Ace, and Sabo still want to become pirates despite his wishes. He attacks them with his usual brutal training methods, causing the brothers to fear for their lives.
events.significance: This event serves as the catalyst for the brothers to leave Dadan's home and strike out on their own, demonstrating their unwavering commitment to their pirate dreams.

quotes.text: You're still saying you want to be pirates?!
quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: Garp confronting the three brothers about their ambitions

events.title: The Brothers Decide to Run Away
events.description: After the beating from Garp, Luffy, Ace, and Sabo decide they need to run away and survive on their own. They fear Garp will kill them the next day if they stay.
events.significance: This decision marks a new level of independence for the three brothers and sets up their construction of the hideout.

events.title: Gathering Materials from Gray Terminal
events.description: The three brothers visit Gray Terminal, the massive junkyard outside the gates of Goa Kingdom, to gather materials for building their hideout. They collect various scrap materials and supplies.
events.significance: Introduces the resourcefulness of the brothers and showcases the Gray Terminal location which becomes important in later episodes of the arc.

events.title: Construction of the Pirate Ship Hideout
events.description: Using Sabo's design skills and materials from Gray Terminal, the three brothers build an elaborate treehouse hideout atop a huge tree in the forest. The structure is designed to resemble a pirate ship, symbolizing their shared dream.
events.significance: The hideout represents the brothers' independence, their shared dreams of becoming pirates, and their strong bond. It serves as their base for the remainder of the flashback arc.

events.title: Setting Up Booby Traps
events.description: The brothers set up elaborate Rube Goldberg-style booby traps around their hideout to protect it from intruders. The traps are designed to be both effective and comical.
events.significance: Showcases the playful and creative nature of the three brothers, as well as their strategic thinking. This also sets up a comedic payoff later in the episode.

events.title: Makino and Woop Slap Visit Luffy
events.description: Makino and Village Mayor Woop Slap come to visit Luffy at Mt. Colubo. When Luffy sees Makino, he immediately runs to her and hugs her, showing their close bond.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's affection for Makino and establishes her role as a maternal/sisterly figure in his childhood. This moment reinforces the caring relationships Luffy has beyond his brothers.

events.title: Dadan's Worry for the Brothers
events.description: When the boys don't return home and storms arrive, Curly Dadan becomes increasingly worried about them. Despite her rough exterior, she reveals her true caring nature as a mother figure by sending her bandits to search for the three brothers.
events.significance: This scene reveals Dadan's character depth, showing that beneath her harsh demeanor, she genuinely cares for the boys she's been raising. It's a key moment of character development for Dadan.

quotes.text: Where are those brats? They should have come back by now!
quotes.speaker: Dadan
quotes.context: Dadan worrying about the missing brothers during a storm

events.title: Dadan Triggers the Booby Trap
events.description: Dadan eventually finds the brothers' hideout and approaches it. She accidentally triggers Ace's elaborate Rube Goldberg trap and gets hit in the face with a mallet, much to the amusement of the boys.
events.significance: A comedic moment that serves as the payoff to the earlier trap setup. It also shows that despite the brothers running away, Dadan still found them and cares enough to search for them.

events.title: Dream Sequence: Luffy Fairy
events.description: In a comedic dream sequence, Dadan is shown having nightmares about the three troublesome boys. A 'Luffy Fairy' appears in her dream, harassing her even in her sleep, showing how much the boys have stretched her sanity to breaking point.
events.significance: A humorous moment that emphasizes the chaotic nature of raising the three brothers and Dadan's exasperation with them, while also hinting at her underlying affection.

quotes.context: Confronting the brothers about their dreams

quotes.text: Where are those brats? They should have come back by now!
quotes.speaker: Dadan

quotes.text: We will stand on our own feet!
quotes.speaker: Luffy, Ace, Sabo
quotes.context: The note the brothers left for Dadan

themes.description: The episode focuses on Luffy, Ace, and Sabo's decision to strike out on their own and build their own home, demonstrating their growing independence and determination to live by their own rules.
themes.symbolism: The pirate ship hideout symbolizes the brothers' shared dream and their independence from authority figures like Garp who oppose their ambitions.

themes.description: Despite Dadan's rough exterior and the brothers' decision to leave, the episode reveals the genuine familial bond between them. Dadan's worry and search for the boys shows she truly cares for them as a mother would.
themes.symbolism: Dadan's dream sequence and her frantic search during the storm represent the anxiety of a parent worried about their children, despite her attempts to appear tough.

themes.description: The brothers' willingness to run away and build their own hideout rather than give up their pirate dreams shows their unwavering commitment to their goals, even in the face of opposition from someone as powerful as Garp.
themes.symbolism: Building the hideout to look like a pirate ship represents their refusal to let anyone crush their dreams.

themes.description: The three brothers work together seamlessly to build their hideout, with each contributing their unique skills. Their cooperation and shared purpose strengthen their bond.
themes.symbolism: The hideout built together represents their unity and the strength of their friendship.

characterSpotlights.development: This episode reveals Dadan's character depth, showing that beneath her harsh, violent exterior, she has grown to genuinely care for Luffy, Ace, and Sabo as a mother figure. Her worry and frantic search for them demonstrates her true feelings.

mangaDifferences.difference: Episode 497 is noted as pure filler that extends the content from a small portion of Chapter 585 (pages 14, 16-17). The anime added significant padding to the manga material, including extended comedic sequences with Dadan and more elaborate scenes of the hideout construction.
The dream sequence with the 'Luffy Fairy' harassing Dadan appears to be anime-original content not present in the manga.

trivia.fact: Episodes 497-499 are considered pure filler episodes that spend additional time with the three brothers before Episode 500 returns to adapting manga content more directly.
This episode achieved a TV rating of 8.0% in Japan, ranking #5 in viewership for its time slot.
The opening song 'Fight Together' by Namie Amuro was the final opening before the timeskip, making it particularly memorable for fans as it marked the end of an era.
In Episode 497, a significantly glorified version of Dadan appears in her dream sequence, with an appearance almost identical to Dadan's younger days depicted in One Piece Green databook.
The Gray Terminal is based on Smokey Mountain, a famous slum in Manila, Philippines, reflecting One Piece's practice of drawing inspiration from real-world locations.
